trans-unit.target: Declare background tasks in the application manifest

trans-unit.source: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.
trans-unit.target: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.

trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: BackgroundTasks Schema
trans-unit.target: BackgroundTasks Schema

trans-unit.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.Background
trans-unit.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.Background

trans-unit.source: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.
trans-unit.target: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.

trans-unit.source: Background tasks but be declared in the app manifest or else your app will not be able to register them (an exception will be thrown).
trans-unit.target: Background tasks but be declared in the app manifest or else your app will not be able to register them (an exception will be thrown).

trans-unit.source: Additionally, background tasks must be declared in the application manifest to pass certification.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, background tasks must be declared in the application manifest to pass certification.

trans-unit.source: This topic assumes you have a created one or more background task classes, and that your app registers each background task to run in response to at least one trigger.
trans-unit.target: This topic assumes you have a created one or more background task classes, and that your app registers each background task to run in response to at least one trigger.

trans-unit.source: Add Extensions Manually
trans-unit.target: Add Extensions Manually

trans-unit.source: Open the application manifest (Package.appxmanifest) and go to the Application element.
trans-unit.target: Open the application manifest (Package.appxmanifest) and go to the Application element.

trans-unit.source: Create an Extensions element (if one doesn't already exist).
trans-unit.target: Create an Extensions element (if one doesn't already exist).

trans-unit.source: The following snippet is taken from the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666):
trans-unit.target: The following snippet is taken from the [background task sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=618666):

trans-unit.source: Add a Background Task Extension
trans-unit.target: Add a Background Task Extension

trans-unit.source: Declare your first background task.
trans-unit.target: Declare your first background task.

trans-unit.source: Copy this code into the Extensions element (you will add attributes in the following steps).
trans-unit.target: Copy this code into the Extensions element (you will add attributes in the following steps).

trans-unit.source: Change the EntryPoint attribute to have the same string used by your code as the entry point when registering your background task (**namespace.classname**).
trans-unit.target: Change the EntryPoint attribute to have the same string used by your code as the entry point when registering your background task (**namespace.classname**).

trans-unit.source: In this example, the entry point is ExampleBackgroundTaskNameSpace.ExampleBackgroundTaskClassName:
trans-unit.target: In this example, the entry point is ExampleBackgroundTaskNameSpace.ExampleBackgroundTaskClassName:

trans-unit.source: Change the list of Task Type attribute to indicate the type of task registration used with this background task.
trans-unit.target: Change the list of Task Type attribute to indicate the type of task registration used with this background task.

trans-unit.source: If the background task is registered with multiple trigger types, add additional Task elements and Type attributes for each one.
trans-unit.target: If the background task is registered with multiple trigger types, add additional Task elements and Type attributes for each one.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Make sure to list each of the trigger types you're using, or the background task will not register with the undeclared trigger types (the [**Register**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224772) method will fail and throw an exception).
trans-unit.target: **Note** Make sure to list each of the trigger types you're using, or the background task will not register with the undeclared trigger types (the [**Register**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224772) method will fail and throw an exception).

trans-unit.source: This snippet example indicates the use of system event triggers and push notifications:
trans-unit.target: This snippet example indicates the use of system event triggers and push notifications:
